alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 23 at 1:46PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated Surf Along the Southern Seward Peninsula This Afternoon and Evening... ...Strong Low Moving to the Lower Yukon Delta Tuesday... South to southeast winds of 20 to 30 mph will produce elevated surf 1 to 2 feet above the normal high tide through this evening along the southern Seward Peninsula coast. With the wave action and elevated water levels low lying areas may have water move into them. A strong low will move to the Lower Yukon Delta Tuesday bringing strong winds, increased wave action, and heavy snowfall to the area. Winds will increase to 20 to 40 mph and become gusty Monday night and Tuesday as they turn from the east and southeast across Norton Sound. As the low moves southeast late Tuesday winds will turn from the north and northeast and diminish. Increased wave action will develop along the southern coast of the Seward Peninsula as the winds increase. Heavy snowfall will move into the area south of the Seward Peninsula by Tuesday afternoon with heavy snow continuing into Wednesday night before it tapering off. Heavy snowfall will extend east to McGrath. Areas along the Seward Peninsula coast may mix with rain during the evening. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
